intro: Brachysorus, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous species that thrive in rocky or coastal environments. They are characterized by their compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The flowers are usually bright yellow or white, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Brachysorus species are often found in temperate regions and are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
